chart.title: Adoption of communication technologies
chart.note: Landline Internet subscriptions are defined as a fixed access to the public Internet with a download speed of at least 256 kbit/s. Internet users are people who have accessed the Internet from any location in the last three months.
chart.citation: International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank) (2025); HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024)

Fixed telephone subscriptions.citationShort: International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank) (2025) – processed by Our World in Data

Fixed broadband subscriptions.citationLong: International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank) (2025) – processed by Our World in Data. “Landline Internet subscriptions” [dataset]. International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank), “World Development Indicators” [original data].

Mobile cellular subscriptions.citationLong: International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank) (2025) – processed by Our World in Data. “Mobile phone subscriptions” [dataset]. International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank), “World Development Indicators” [original data].

Number of Internet users.descriptionShort: The number of individuals using the Internet.
Number of Internet users.descriptionProcessing: The number of internet users is calculated by Our World in Data based on internet access figures as a share of the total population, published in the World Development Indicators by the World Bank and total population figures from the UN World Population Prospects, Gapminder and HYDE."
Number of Internet users.citationShort: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Number of Internet users.citationLong: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Internet users” [dataset]. International Telecommunication Union (via World Bank), “World Development Indicators”; Various sources, “Population” [original data].
